#include "eol_model.h"

Data Structures

struct  eolActor

Functions

void eol_actor_load (eolActor *act, char *filename)
 loads an actor from file and returns a pointer to it. based on the file information, it will also load up mesh, sprite, etc data.
void eol_actor_clear (eolActor *act)
 clears any of the actor information at the location specified
eolActor * eol_actor_new ()
 allocated empty actor data;
void eol_actor_free (eolActor **actor)
 frees all data pointed to by actor
void eol_actor_set_frame_rate (eolActor *act, eolFloat rate)
 sets the actor's frame change rate. this is in float to allow granular speed up and slowdown of an animation Note that actions have their own frame rates that will combine with the actor frame rate to determine the final change in frames.
void eol_actor_set_action (eolActor *act, eolWord action)
 set the actor to the begining of the specified action
eolBool eol_actor_next_frame (eolActor *act)
 steps an actor to the next frame in an action. lets caller know if if the action has reached the end. if the actor was already at the end, it will... if type is loop: set the frame back to the beginning. if type is osci: sets the animation direction to -1 if type is pass: frame is not changed
eolFloat eol_actor_get_frame (eolActor *act)
 retrieve the current frame of an actor
void eol_actor_draw (eolActor *act, eolVec3D position, eolVec3D rotation, eolVec3D scale, eolVec3D color, eolFloat alpha)
 draw the actor under the current conditions
void eol_actor_draw_wire (eolActor *act, eolVec3D position, eolVec3D rotation, eolVec3D scale, eolVec3D color, eolFloat alpha)

eolVec3D  position,
eolVec3D  rotation,
eolVec3D  scale,
eolVec3D  color,
eolFloat  alpha 
)

draw the actor under the current conditions

Parameters:
act pointer to the actor to draw
position the place to draw the actor
rotation how the actor is rotated
scale how the actor is scaled
color color shifting of the actor (1,1,1) is no change.
alpha the tranlucency of the actor 0 is clear, 1 is opaque

frees all data pointed to by actor

Definition at line 103 of file eol_actor.c.

eolFloat eol_actor_get_frame ( eolActor *  act  ) 

retrieve the current frame of an actor

Parameters:
act the actor to retrieve the frame from
Returns:
a floating point representing the frame. Note that when drawing, it will snap to the floor.

Definition at line 177 of file eol_actor.c.

void eol_actor_load ( eolActor *  act,
char *  filename 
)

loads an actor from file and returns a pointer to it. based on the file information, it will also load up mesh, sprite, etc data.

Parameters:
act the actor data to load into. It will clear any existing data.
filename the model file to load

Definition at line 10 of file eol_actor.c.

eolActor* eol_actor_new (  ) 

allocated empty actor data;

Returns:
a pointer to a valid empty actor or NULL on error

Definition at line 88 of file eol_actor.c.

eolBool eol_actor_next_frame ( eolActor *  act  ) 

steps an actor to the next frame in an action. lets caller know if if the action has reached the end. if the actor was already at the end, it will... if type is loop: set the frame back to the beginning. if type is osci: sets the animation direction to -1 if type is pass: frame is not changed

Parameters:
act the actor to animate
Returns:
eolTrue if the action has reached the end, false otherwise. looping never returns false pass returns true after a single pass oscillate returns true after a single pass forward and back.

Definition at line 136 of file eol_actor.c.

void eol_actor_set_action ( eolActor *  act,
eolWord  action 
)

set the actor to the begining of the specified action

Parameters:
act the actor to modify
action the name of the action to set it to. If name is not found, nothing changes.

Definition at line 111 of file eol_actor.c.

void eol_actor_set_frame_rate ( eolActor *  act,
eolFloat  rate 
)

sets the actor's frame change rate. this is in float to allow granular speed up and slowdown of an animation Note that actions have their own frame rates that will combine with the actor frame rate to determine the final change in frames.

Parameters:
act the actor whose frame rate will change
rate the amount of change. Note that a rate of 0 means the actor will not animate

Definition at line 72 of file eol_actor.c.
